comments: (Sarah: Next on Jeopardy!: find out everything about Alcatraz, and maybe even... how to get out of here!)

clues.clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew gets put in her place on Alcatraz.)  From the Latin for "alone", it's the type of cell I've been put into, either for punishment or for my own protection
Films made about Alcatraz include "Birdman of Alcatraz", "Escape from Alcatraz" & this 1996 Sean Connery actioner
(Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the cluefrom the tower.)  Doing what many inmates had long wanted to do, this illusionist escaped from Alcatraz in a 1987 TV special
After this man's release from Alcatraz in 1939, he was unable to regain control of the Chicago mob & retired to Florida
(Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports.)  The name Alcatraz is derived from the Spanish for "island of" these birds, that come in brown & white varities
